department_name: Sonoma County Department of Health Services, Environmental Health & Safety Section

grading_system.description: Color-coded placard system implemented June 1, 2016. Green for Pass (no more than 1 major violation correctable during inspection), Yellow for Conditional Pass (2+ major violations), Red for Closed (immediate health threat).

inspection_details.frequency: All food facilities inspected once or twice per year. Facilities with moderate/extensive food prep inspected twice yearly, minimal prep once yearly.
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Yellow or red placards require follow-up inspection. Major violations and permit suspensions trigger reinspections.
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Placards posted visibly at facility entrance. Inspection reports available online within 72 hours. Color-coded search available on county website.

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Permit Sonoma Fire Prevention and Hazardous Materials Division
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: NFPA 96 compliance required. Commercial kitchen fire suppression systems must be inspected every 6 months by licensed fire protection company.

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - Part of California Health and Safety Code, based on FDA Food Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by Sonoma County Environmental Health specialists
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Sonoma County Code supplements CalCode. Color-coded placard system is local ordinance approved March 1, 2016.

confidence_notes: Comprehensive information found from official Sonoma County sources and local news coverage. Grading system clearly documented as color-coded pass/fail rather than letter grades or numerical scores.
verification_notes: All key information verified from official county sources. CalCode basis confirmed. Fire safety requirements follow standard NFPA protocols.
